inscription: stamped on verso, LLC, in black: © 1982 BERT STERN / ALL RIGHTS RESERVED / Photograph by / BERT STERN / NOT TO BE REPRODUCED IN ANY / MEDIA WITHOUT PRIOR / WRITTEN CONSENT FROM / THE PHOTOGRAPHER | verso in blue pencil, graphite pencil, and black pencil: UNIQUE / HAND TINTED / BS / 96 / PLB 61 / Printed 1990 / Taken 1962 / VOGUE 1982 / MARILYN MONROE -
signed: at bottom edge in pencil: Marilyn 1962 Bert Stern (signature illegible) | verso in blue ink, LLC: Bert Stern (illegible) | see Inscriptions
text: This portrait of Marilyn Monroe by Bert Stern is deliberately provocative. Holding large flowers fashioned from towels to her breasts, a heavy-lidded Monroe seems to exhibit the sensuous playfulness expected of her public persona. While Stern’s soft lighting creates an atmosphere of intimacy, an uneasy feeling lingers; Monroe’s torso torques awkwardly at the bottom of the frame and the edges of her hair, face, and body seem to be feathering away, insubstantial against the too-brightly-lit background. In performing for the camera, Monroe and Stern (perhaps unwittingly) illuminate her overall vulnerability within his studio and in a culture that commodified her image.
title: Marilyn with Roses
